newsitem.title: UK: Sugar freight business routine, Santos stays focus.
newsitem.headline: Sugar freight business routine, Santos stays focus.

text.p: South Brazil continued as the main focus of demand on the sugar freight market on Wednesday and shipbrokers said most quoted business was routine with little concern over port congestion.
Glencore quoted for 25,000 tonnes in bulk from Santos to the Black Sea for August/September and 5,000 tonnes of bagged sugar from the same origin to Tema and Lagos for early September.
South Africa Sugar Association (SASA) was open for 17,000 tonnes from Durban to Japan for early September.
Firmer business included Mauritius Sugar Syndicate (MSS), which was reported to have fixed 18/18,250 tonnes of bulk sugar on its normal Port Louis to London route for September 9 at around stg 16.00.

Shipbrokers said Fiji Sugar Marketing fixed 20,000 tonnes of bulk sugar from Fiji to London for September 10/20, with the rate achieved thought to be just under $30.00, under the rate for previous similar orders.
Genoc was on subjects with its order for 14,000 tonnes of bagged sugar from Santos or Paranagua to Aqaba, Jeddah or Aden for early September.
Seven Seas fixed 12,000 tonnes in bags from south China to Pakistan for prompt dates at around $25.
